tweet: Reverend Hilson’s efforts were instrumental in the fight to recognize Martin Luther King Jr. Day in NH. He shared Dr. King’s vision to make the world a better, fairer place for all.

As we approach MLK Day, I spoke at North Church in Portsmouth where I highlighted the extraordinary legacy of Dr. King’s fight for justice and paid tribute to the late Reverend Dr. Arthur Hilson. pic.twitter.com/OANMY1XgJA
I urge the Trump administration to step back from this proposal and I urge Granite Staters of all political stripes to speak out in opposition. #nhpolitics

Considering the substantial water contamination challenges New Hampshire already faces, it's absolutely reckless of the Trump administration to be overruling hard science and siding with special interests to rollback these important wetland regulations.

I’m glad that the Department of Justice has awarded a $994K grant to @UofNH to conduct a new National Juvenile Online Victimization Study. The data collected will help ensure law enforcement have the info they need to protect children and teens.

As young people increasingly utilize rapidly evolving online technology, it has never been more important for law enforcement to understand the threats that are emerging on the internet, including exploitation and sex trafficking.

I’m very pleased that the House moved today to advance legislation requiring the EPA to list PFOA and PFOS as hazardous substances eligible for cleanup funds. This is an important step towards improving the federal response to contamination and holding polluters responsible.

According to reports, 228 American police officers died by suicide last year – a record number. As this figure was compiled using only public reports, the actual total number of suicides may be higher than we know. This is a national crisis that demands the attention of Congress.

I'm thrilled that New Hampshire will receive a $26.8 million dollar federal preschool development grant that will be administered by @UofNH. Early childhood education has been a priority for me throughout my service to New Hampshire and will always continue to be a top priority.

Good quality preschool programs provide invaluable support to working families and help build an educational foundation for children that lasts a lifetime. That’s why I’ve fought in Congress for additional funding for our preschool programs.
